    • Method Detail

      • finish

        boolean finish()
        If user enters N (No), program will finish work, otherwise program continues its work.
        Returns:
        true if entered N (NO), otherwise return false.

      • inputNote

        java.lang.String inputNote(java.lang.String message,
                           java.lang.String regex)
        Reads and checks the input value.
        Parameters:
        message - the message for print to the console.
        regex - the regular expression.
        Returns:
        correct value.

      • inputLogin

        java.lang.String inputLogin(java.lang.String message,
                            java.lang.String regex)
                     throws UniqueValueException
        Returns login, if it is correct and unique. If login isn't unique, throws runtime exception, that such login already exists.
        Parameters:
        message - the message for print to the console.
        regex - the regular expression.
        Returns:
        correct and unique login.
        Throws:
        UniqueValueException - if this login isn't unique.
